noun.description: A friar, sister, or lay member of a Christian religious order founded in 1209 by St. Francis of Assisi, or of an order based on Franciscan rule. The Franciscan orders are noted for preachers and missionaries.

adjective.description: Relating to or denoting St. Francis or the Franciscans.

origin: From French franciscain, from modern Latin Franciscanus, from Franciscus Francis.
